newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Eureko Ireland acquires Touchline's Irish business.
newsitem.headline: Eureko Ireland acquires Touchline's Irish business.

text.p: The insurance company, Eureko Ireland, said on Friday it had acquired the Irish operations of Touchline Insurance through its subsidiary, Celtic Direct.
Eureko said in a statement that it intends to integrate the operations of Touchline with Celtic and hopes to become one of the largest direct players in the insurance market.
Touchline, owned by a French insurance and banking group, GAN, reported premium income of over six million Irish pounds in 1996, the statement said.
Celtic had total premium income of 25.7 million Irish pounds in 1996.
The new business will trade under the existing two brand names for the immediate future.
The takeover of Touchline is the fourth acquisition by Eureko since it first entered the Irish market in 1993, it said.
